title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

General Considerations

For Task A, the response must identify the political affiliation of people who are most likely to believe elected officials should compromise.

For Task B, the response must correctly describe the difference between Democrats and Republicans on their attitudes of whether government officials should stick to their principles, based on the data in the bar graph.

For Task C, the response must correctly explain how the data in the bar graph could influence how a Republican candidate would shift his or her campaign positions after securing the Republican nomination for president.

For Task D, the response must correctly explain how the data in the bar graph could affect policy making interactions between the president and Congress.

The point for each criterion is earned independently.
descriptions: The response accomplishes none of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes any one of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes two of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes three of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes all four of the tasks set by the question.
